TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {455=The implementation of this interface follows the REC-DOM-Level-1-19981001.}
textBeforeTable: Table 155-26 CREATEATTRIBUTE Function Parameters Parameters RETURN DOMATTR; ns IN VARCHAR2) qname IN VARCHAR2, doc IN DOMDOCUMENT, DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATEATTRIBUTE(  Creates a DOMATTR with the specified name and namespace URI: RETURN DOMATTR; name IN VARCHAR2) doc IN DOMDOCUMENT, DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATEATTRIBUTE(  Creates a DOMATTR with the specified name: Syntax DOMDocument Subprograms See Also: This function creates a DOMATTR node. CREATEATTRIBUTE Functions Cloning any other type of node simply returns a copy of this node. Cloning an Attribute directly, as opposed to be cloned as part of an Element cloning operation, returns a specified attribute (specified is TRUE). Cloning an Element copies all attributes and their values, including those generated by the XML processor to represent defaulted attributes, but this method does not copy any text it contains unless it is a deep clone, since the text is contained in a child Text node. Usage Notes Determines if children are to be cloned deep DOMNODE n Description Parameter Table
textAfterTable: CREATECDATASECTION Function This function creates a DOMCDATASECTION node.
